title: Test Util 2D and 3D - Utilities Demonstration
description: Comprehensive demonstration of FloPy's core array handling utilities for managing 2D and 3D data arrays in MODFLOW models with time-varying capabilities

packages.purpose: 2D array handling with constant and variable data support
3D array management with layer-specific operations and scaling
Time-varying 2D arrays across stress periods for dynamic data
Time-varying 3D arrays with temporal flexibility and period control
List-based data structures for boundary condition management
Layer property flow package with 3D hydraulic properties
Well package demonstrating MfList stress period data
Recharge package with transient 2D array input

package_details.Util2d: 2D array handling with external file support and formatting
package_details.Util3d: 3D array operations with layer-specific control and scaling
package_details.Transient3d: Time-dependent 3D arrays for complex temporal modeling
package_details.MfList: Stress period data management for boundary conditions
package_details.ModflowLpf: Layer property flow with heterogeneous hydraulic fields
package_details.ModflowWel: Well boundary conditions with temporal variation
package_details.ModflowRch: Recharge boundary conditions with spatial-temporal patterns

key_features: Time-varying array support for transient simulations
External file I/O with text and binary format support
MfList boundary condition data structure management
Array formatting and control record generation
Integration with MODFLOW packages for complete models
Statistical analysis and spatial heterogeneity tools
learning_objectives: Understanding FloPy's core array handling utilities
Mastering 2D array creation and manipulation techniques
Managing time-varying data with Transient2d and Transient3d
Using MfList for boundary condition data structures
Performing file I/O operations with arrays (text/binary)
Creating spatial heterogeneity and realistic property fields
Integrating array utilities in complete MODFLOW workflows
Applying statistical analysis to hydraulic property fields
